Class ViewData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.ViewData
public final class ViewData extends Object
An immutable Data Transfer Object (DTO) containing a snapshot of the board's dynamic state.

Architectural Role: This class acts as the bridge between the Model (Board) and the View (GameRenderer). It packages all necessary rendering data (active piece, ghost position, hold piece, next queue) into a single object.

Immutability: To ensure thread safety and data integrity, this class performs defensive copying on all mutable array fields. This prevents the View from accidentally modifying the internal state of the Model.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewData

      public ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, List<int[][]> upcomingBricksData, int ghostYPosition, int[][] holdBrickData)
      Constructs a new snapshot of the board state.
      Parameters:
      brickData - matrix representing the current falling brick shape.
      xPosition - current X coordinate of the falling brick.
      yPosition - current Y coordinate of the falling brick.
      upcomingBricksData - list of matrices for the "Next Piece" preview.
      ghostYPosition - calculated Y coordinate where the brick would land (Ghost Piece).
      holdBrickData - matrix representing the brick currently in the "Hold" slot.

  • Method Details

    • getBrickData

      public int[][] getBrickData()
      Retrieves the shape matrix of the currently falling brick.
      Returns:
      a safe copy of the 2D integer array.

    • getxPosition

      public int getxPosition()
      Retrieves the current horizontal position of the falling brick.
      Returns:
      the grid column index.

    • getyPosition

      public int getyPosition()
      Retrieves the current vertical position of the falling brick.
      Returns:
      the grid row index.

    • getUpcomingBricksData

      public List<int[][]> getUpcomingBricksData()
      Retrieves the list of shapes for the "Next Piece" preview sidebar.

      Deep Copy: Iterates through the list and copies every matrix to ensure full encapsulation.

      Returns:
      a new list containing safe copies of the upcoming brick matrices.

    • getGhostYPosition

      public int getGhostYPosition()
      Retrieves the calculated Y-coordinate for the Ghost Piece.

      The renderer uses this to draw a semi-transparent hint showing where the brick will land if a Hard Drop is performed.

      Returns:
      the projected landing row index.

    • getHoldBrickData

      public int[][] getHoldBrickData()
      Retrieves the shape matrix of the held brick.
      Returns:
      a safe copy of the hold piece matrix, or an empty matrix if nothing is held.
